full_text: We've four great candidates running in the by-elections today. I think we have a real chance of winning. Every vote counts. If you live in one of the constituencies then please #votegreen1 before 10pm tonight. https://t.co/A6xZcHfS3q
Whose future? Our future! Whose planet? Our planet! Whose lives? Our lives! #schoolstrike4climate #Fridays4Future #ClimateStrike  @GretaThunberg #dublin #Ireland https://t.co/qJjTigPtZx
Dubsky Sounds. It's a disco canvass on Esmond Street, Gorey for @KarinDubsky Teas, cakes and sweet tunes. #votegreen1 #WantGreenVoteGreen #wexford https://t.co/swvIfxT1NR
Vote Green #1 this Friday.  #wantgreenvotegreen @joefingalgreen #Fingal https://t.co/7snUC1ovxD
Heading home after a great night canvassing for @joefingalgreen in the Fingal by-election this Friday.  #votegreen1 https://t.co/7w8fL44rPG

EU rules requiring this consultation were agreed a year ago. Not fair that it's only open to the public today & closes 15 days later, leaving the Government just 9 more days to amend our whole EU climate strategy. This is the key document which will determine our economic future. https://t.co/Ex7np2E8Pu

.@TheKavOfficial gives a team talk to his canvassers in Palmerstown this evening. It's hard running a bye-election campaign but a great privilege to put yourself forward before the people. Hoping #DublinMidWest will #votegreen1 on Friday. #wantgreenvotegreen https://t.co/5BTdeUpX23

@immdaly @greenparty_ie @LeoVaradkar @FineGael Of course we should always be forgiving of the person but my criticism relates to a political decision by @LeoVaradkar to attend the canvass. He originally critisised the comments but his presence yesterday sends a very different message. I think it's valid to question that call.

.@LeoVaradkar could have stayed away from the Wexford campaign trail yesterday.  Instead by turning up to support Verona Murphy he sends a clear signal that @FineGael tolerates the way she raised fears about refugees, to bolster her own campaign. #shame https://t.co/CromVSisFc
Great to be out with @RevTrev10 and @joefingalgreen on the final week of the campaign trail. #wantgreenvotegreen https://t.co/SGngj2UVWP

.@TheGreenMcCabe 'There's a right way & a wrong way of tackling climate change. We need to do it by treating workers & farmers with dignity. This starts in local communities & works from the bottom up. The only way we'll keep dignity at the heart of it is if we all get involved.' https://t.co/ilJZsbi5u7

Great crowd at the launch of our candidates for the two Meath constituencies in the next general election: @TheGreenMcCabe & @SeamusMcMenamin We are still seeing the #GreenWave continuing to rise. I think we might surprise people in what comes next. #climatejustice https://t.co/OGGhWzLQSg

Enjoyed debating at @OxfordUnion last night, against the motion that we cannot trust mainstream media. We need a new advertising & public service model which insures everyone can access quality journalism. It has to be citizen/community centred, not just under corporate control. https://t.co/4Psxr44m7F
It has been a privilige and a pleasure to work with @eoinwilson for the last ten years. #nobetterman https://t.co/MD8QzoHPUc

.@Cyclistie @dublincycling @IBIKEDublin presented to Oireachtas Transport Committee today. Agreed we have to normalise cycling across the country. As it happens, on this wet & cold day, there was a equal number of bikes & cars parked on the Kildare Street side of Leinster House. https://t.co/jy3sYa3ZwV
The youth assembly on climate change is starting now in Dail Éireann. You can watch live through the day via @RTENewsNow https://t.co/8nKAxrimP8 https://t.co/RtKn5F1PPF
There is still hope https://t.co/mNwrLDRUOw
The Taoiseach had no answer to the question, where is all the increased traffic from a widened M11 going to go? https://t.co/GFfL4AhNnt
Safe journey @GretaThunberg aboard #lavagabonde sailing to Spain for #COP25 https://t.co/Xon7oraAOM  https://t.co/wJ6wTvs8vR

Cracking programme by @rte @boucherhayes on how we can reduce our climate emissions.  Greener, more profitable farming.  Rewetting peatlands.  Promoting bikes not cars.  Close to nature, continuous cover forestry. Offshore wind. Marine protected areas.  #hotair #RTEonclimate https://t.co/DtIPC04ZWo

Twenty years ago we argued for public transport solutions rather than widening the N11 at the Glen of the Downs. The same argument still applies today. Widening all the motorways approaching a gridlocked Dublin is pure madness. We have to change our ways.  https://t.co/uZgP2TKlGX

On a day of @rte job losses @AineKerr argues we've a wicked  'information disorder' problem, where the connection between people & quality journalism is being lost. We need new models of regulating the internet which also allow us protect free speech. #InternationalGrandCommittee https://t.co/c3A2RXSqIB

Very embarrassing that our Data Protection Commissioner had to admit before our #InternationalGrandCommittee that the Irish Government didn't agree to the full resources request she made in Budget 2020. An incredibly short sighted decision which should be reversed. #digitalrights https://t.co/Qu6ECSUCxJ

You can watch live throughout the day our International Grand Committee on Disinformation and Fake news:  https://t.co/PQkMyIAwVS We want to get international collaboration on the regulation and governance of online social media platforms. https://t.co/gXR2rntGw4

There's a growing movement working for global online platform regulation & accountability. Have we turned our public debating space from a town square into a shopping mall? Is this now a threat to our democracies? What can Ireland do? @CIGIonline #InternationalGrandCommittee https://t.co/xN2Ra3kk9O

In advance of our #InternationalGrandCommittee on disinformation & fake news tomorrow, @CIGIonline are holding an all day workshop on International Cooperation on Platform Governance. We hope Dublin can be a safe space to work out what good internet regulation looks like. https://t.co/5tC6sTcCS1

A discussion starts in @littlemuseumdub on Digital disruption in Ireland's next election. It's the start of events in Dublin over next 2 days looking at how we might get international collaboration in online governance of disinformation & fake news. Hosted tonight by @LizCarolan https://t.co/zvL81q7pIj

The Government is failing to tackle climate change, in transport, land use and in energy policy.  I made the case for more radical action on the 'Floating Voter' podcast with @KevDoyle-Indo and @Philip_Ryan. You can listen back here: https://t.co/JgkpxyQ27h

Members of @ExtinctRebelsIE chill outside Leinster House, while pouring scorn on the comments from @LeoVaradkar that climate change may bring a silver lining in the form of warmer winter days. https://t.co/qg6fFTg7ms https://t.co/KQdPzDCKI6

I was proud to recieve the James Joyce award from @UCDLandH. Speaking to the society on climate change, I argued that their founder's idea of a university was as relevant as ever. We need a liberal education  to help us meet the challenge ahead. https://t.co/l9XDDZ5f0G @ucddublin https://t.co/LXfPTv0LMq

Wishing @Martin_Kenny and his family well and our full support, following the cowardly attack last night. He is to be commended for standing up what is right. We have to make sure such intiminidation never wins in the end. https://t.co/BrrPGUNlH3
“The more we can get, the stronger our hand will be in any negotiation. I prefer not to talk it up too much because the electorate will have to make that decision." https://t.co/LfuNfeKqSg

.@billmckibben "If we don't win soon we will never win. MLK said the arc of the moral universe is long but bends towards justice. Unfortunately the arc of the physical universe is short & now bends towards heat. The planet is outside it's comfort zone. We must act fast." #Climate https://t.co/6EjNGmxfto

Honoured to be speaking at the #inspirationforum in the small Czech city of https://t.co/KGhhA4TqXD and to be able to hear the latest thinking from @billmckibben of @350. A real source of inspiration to so many people in the climate movement. @MFDFJihlava https://t.co/MvW7uVaCF3

.@pippa_hackett will be a great addition to Seanad Éireann. Her experience as a mother, farmer, scientist, runner, and community organiser can be put to good use, as we start to address the agriculture crisis facing our country.  https://t.co/rifMVASmdp

Looking forward tonight to helping launch a new book by @LucyWBMcA, which examins the philosophy of how we can best address the ecological emergency. It's an important book, which is full of insight. Teachers Club Parnell Square 630pm. #ecology #realisation #compassion #agency https://t.co/kP7wqZeOUb

We found out last week the Government have until tomorrow to remove the Shannon LNG facility from the list of EU Projects of Common Interest. We should be developing offshore wind instead and keep all new fossil fuels in the ground. #KeepItInTheGround #ShannonLNG https://t.co/uKHSTXZfOO
At Luke's Cross in Cork, helping to launch the @oliver_moran campaign for the upcoming Cork North Central by-election. @CorkGreens abú. https://t.co/OzVHiirSRG

Here's the text of the letter to @CommunicorpIRL that all the parties in the Dail have signed. We remind the company of the desirability of maintaining independent editorial control of programme content and ask they remove their ban on the @TheCurrency_  & @IrishTimes. #FreePress https://t.co/kNy0emLOLS

My suggestion for car pooling facilities in our towns & villages was to give people more options & not to restrict the number of cars. A lot of young people cannot afford to buy a car. This is one way of giving them mobility, without it costing the earth.  https://t.co/yvUhCbUEws
I have asked @rteliveline to allow me respond on air to the misrepresentation of what I was saying in regard to car pooling.

@FardeyJ @IrishTimes June. I agree car sharing is more suited to villages and towns rather than more rural areas, which is why I mentioned the village idea in my comments.  Still think we have to look at new local bus services and other mobility solutions as well as the car for those rural areas.

@EoinPoil @IrishTimes Brendan I agree we need to look at how we can provide better transport solutions for every area including Blacksod.  In many cases the main option will still be by car but that should not stop us looking for other workable solutions to give people choice.
@ademonkiss Not saying that at all. Everyone will have their own needs and ways of moving around which works best for them.  Just want to give as much choice and low cost solutions as possible.
@FreelanceWebDev I agree fully and would like to see a whole range of new rural public transport solutions.

@stejmurphy @donaloflynn @philipnolan1 @GraceOSllvn @MarcKC_Green Stephen, I hope you might still join.  I think our response to the climate/biodiversity crisis requires as broad a coalition as possible. That in turn leads me to try and work with whoever the Irish people select as their representatives. Pushing for consensus and more ambition.

@aoife_kirk I never said you don't need to own a car to live in rural Ireland. I know so many people do have to use one. Nor do I want to demonise people but rather would like rural Ireland to have access to better public transport & some of the new shared mobility services coming on stream.

@RosemarieMacS @IrishTimes Sorry for the confusion. Tackling our climate & Biodiversity crisis will need everyone & everyplace on board. All of Ireland will have to benefit from the transition. The last thing I want is an urban/rural divide or to undermine the real desire people do have to play their part.

@donaloflynn @philipnolan1 @GraceOSllvn @MarcKC_Green Donal I'm sorry for the upset caused but think my suggestion is not being accurately reported. I tried to explain it on @OceanFmIreland yesterday. It's not about restricting people or saying you can't have a car but about giving people more options.  https://t.co/yvUhCbUEws

@paddykell @colettebrowne Very much regret that people were annoyed by the comment but hope I can make it clear that car pooling could provide people more choice rather than restricting anything they do at the moment. I tried to clarify it here on a radio show yesterday:  https://t.co/yvUhCbUEws

@ismiseleenie @Dogbowl31Medb @IrishTimes I agree, we have to provide more rural public transport. My suggestion for car pooling was to provide other options as well and not to force anyone away from whatever works best for them.  I tried to set out the idea in this radio interview yesterday. https://t.co/yvUhCbUEws

@RosemarieMacS @IrishTimes I think what I was suggesting has been inaccurately reported. I was promoting car sharing schemes to give people extra options, not to force anyone out from having or using their car.  I tried to correct the record in this interview.  https://t.co/yvUhCbUEws

@Jackie_HealyRae @cleomurphy64 @kerrytodayrk Jackie, it seems around 1 to every 30 is a ratio that works best elsewhere but remember this isn't about forcing people to do anything but rather giving as much choice as possible & helping people save money. Already starting in urban Ireland, I think rural areas could also gain.

@gibbsmahon Agreed we need more rural public transport. Car sharing would complement not exclude people having their own cars. Saving people money and giving people who can't afford a car accsss to one when they need it.

Our Oireachtas Climate Action committee is holding a hearing on the issue of the potential importation of liquified natural gas into Ireland. you can watch live via committee room 1 here: https://t.co/PQkMyIAwVS #KeepItInTheGround #NOLNG https://t.co/2LEsDw8O6Z

@kevinMRALLY Spent a lot of my working life before the dail on the highways and byways of rural Ireland and think we need a transport revolution there as well as in our cities. Our job is to help deliver  it.
@DonalOKelly @RTERadio1 Donal, I spoke about it in the Dail last Thursday and have copied the report below. https://t.co/2FEWxulyCu
@Jamiecm81 @greenparty_ie yes but would like to have given the revenues back as a per capita dividend which would have been more progressive.

.@FineGael make token climate efforts.  €9m on cycling will only fund one good urban route.   €3m on new green agri pilot but @agriculture_ie spends more on office equipment.   €6m on #JustTransition within a social welfare budget of €21 billion.  #WeNeedToMakeABiggerLeap https://t.co/Ydh10IfST6

Avoiding a hard Irish Border in any #Brexit deal is about so much more than creating a single market or avoiding custom checks. Regulatory alignment will require common environmental standards because nature doesn't divide along nationalist lines. Hope this can be agreed in time. https://t.co/C5A5FKsMEd

I presume this is a Dominic Cummings view on #Brexit negotiations with the Irish Government.  Hard to tell the truth from spin but worrying that everyone does seems to be waiting on a UK election before making the next move.   https://t.co/Yla7F9Afw3

I agree, Ireland will gain by going green. To make it happen we need more leadership from Government. We should prioritise transport spending on active travel & public transport, adopt a new forestry model to restore biodiversity and allow communities sell power back to the grid. https://t.co/kkAshhQLVV
.#bígílinn All aboard. #ExtinctionRebellion starts #RebellionWeek by sailing up Kildare Street. @ExtinctRebelsIE @ExtinctionR #InternationalRebellion #Dublin https://t.co/E09KiMF0Jc

.@ExtinctRebelsIE gather outside Dail Eireann at a start of a week of protest in Dublin, protesting against the lack of political action in response to the climate & biodiversity crisis we face. #ExtinctionRebellion #InternationalRebellion #Dublin https://t.co/cXdrcBmjRB

One of the biggest questions in politics today; how do we regulate the internet to maintain freedom of expression but protect against electoral interference, disinformation, fake news & hate speech? https://t.co/HBXliO1rWx

This is the case we make in our dail motion on forestry last week. We need to switch away from short rotation plantations to more natural woodlands. Using rewilding, agroforestry & silviculture to restore biodiversity as well as storing carbon. @FineGael were the only objectors https://t.co/LIvU0ACIFI
@Dawson40M @greenparty_ie Mortified for that slip but confident the rest of the numbers in the submission are on the money.

We published our budget 2000 submission today. Showing how we can tackle the climate and biodiversity crisis in a way that protects the vulnerable,  shares the burden fairly and delivers a decent future for our young people. @greenparty_ie #JustTransition  https://t.co/mmJdZ7jXhx https://t.co/uEHNIdw0Ge

@deegandeegan11 I think stored hydrogen created by electrolysis using renewable power will be part of the future but a lot of research, development & large scale deployment will be needed to bring costs down.

In the papers, on the radio & in the Dail, I hear some people saying we need to import and find more gas for our security. On the other hand I read the scientific consensus, which is clear as can be, those fuels are the greatest threat to all our future. #keepitintheground #NOLNG https://t.co/JgVWzPnZcR

We got agreement from all parties & groups in the Dail today to ask @CommunicorpIRL to reverse their decision to ban @TheCurrency_ & @IrishTimes journalists from their radio stations. A healthy democracy requires open & fair debate. We look forward to hearing their reply. #media https://t.co/1hAJDGmNII

'If rewilding is carried out alongside an agricultural transformation it could bring about not just a rejuvenation of nature, but also a revitalisation of rural communities.' @saoirse_mchugh #rewilding https://t.co/Hifeo5NQ32
@VincentMcCann4 I am afraid it was a lot worse today than anything i'd seen before. Covering everything from the South Wall, around the Shellybanks and up to the Strand Road.

Of 77 water bodies in the Liffey catchment area 48 are at risk of not meeting EU Water Framework Directive objectives. 5 of our transitional and coastal water areas are also at risk. We ignored environmental directives for years & are now paying the price. https://t.co/e1BA27pYJO https://t.co/eWYWQ6aeks

A beautiful Sunday afternoon but not a soul out on Sandymount strand due to the carpet of brown algae sludge which is covering the beach. It's there because of excess nitrogen & phosphate runoff into the bay from our agriculture & sewerage systems. #dublin https://t.co/DSKwJKC3hO https://t.co/Sre0d3ee0o
@robbimoran Science.
Batten down the hatches for Thursday, #Lorenzo might be coming our way. #ClimateChange https://t.co/osXDaE4aMb

.@SVP_Ireland are right. We have to do a whole range of things, including a massive increase in retrofitting & anti poverty measures. Carbon tax is only one of the climate actions we need to take and refunding all the revenue back is the most appropriate way of protecting people. https://t.co/zHZglSRJSY

At a Climate Action Committee to consider the impact of rising carbon taxes. @ESRIDublin analysis shows that returning all the revenue to every person via either a social welfare increase or tax credit would undo any regressive impacts and reduce income inequality. #ClimateAction https://t.co/wtxJlbLSYi
@SenCurran2 Sean Id be happy to give whatever advice I can if you want to contact my dail office via eamon.ryan@oireacthas.ie

Most importantly we need proper  public consultation & environmental planning so we protect sensitive habitats & maximise community gain. We need full transparency & related marine protected areas to restore bird & sea life. https://t.co/nONdkXirkt @BirdWatchIE @IWEA @NatureNymph

It won't be possible to balance 70% renewable power in 2030 without more interconnection with our neighbours. The UK will need to do the same. No matter what happens with #brexit I think they'll be involved in regional energy cooperation. https://t.co/54P7d1tIn6 @Energy4Europe

One big problem is that the return for turbine manufacturers is still a fraction of what oil & gas companies are getting. It's another reason why we must shut those unsustainable exploration business down & use their enginerring skills to build renewables. https://t.co/ZWhoG6bEPp

Our sea area is ten times our land area & capacity factors are estimated at over 60%, so we've huge potential. @seai are now planning for a floating turbine at their Belmullet grid link test site. If they can survive in those seas, they can work anywhere. https://t.co/evDL2mJOXE

A key goal will be to develop supply chain jobs in Rosslare, Dublin, Belfast, Moneypoint & Killbegs. The first wind farms are likely to be in the Irish Sea, close to Dublin where the grid is strongest. Longer term we can head South and West to deeper seas. https://t.co/NkcFWRue5T https://t.co/wrjcbdbLPz

There are over 105 offshore wind farms in EU. New auctions have brought prices down as low as €45 per mwh, while our current wholesale electricity price is €62 mwh. We aim to have 3.5 GW intalled by 2030 but will have competition in getting turbines, as other countries ramp up. https://t.co/FuPh4LyuhW

I hosted a workshop today with @EUFORES_EU & @Energy4Europe asking how offshore wind can help us meet our energy/climate targets. Many thanks @merrionstreet @Dept_CCAE @UtilityregCRU @IWEA @MarieCDonnelly @MainstreamRP @SEAI_ie @EirGrid @foeireland & @BirdWatchIE for taking part. https://t.co/9LWJy3vp6w

Demand for fossil gas in Europe must decline steeply over next 2 decades, if the EU is to stick to its climate plan. An ongoing over-investment in gas infrastructure means the risk of stranded assets is far bigger than fears about security of supply. https://t.co/vJi0ex7HRz @E3G https://t.co/ybAObl3Nvp

I welcome @LeoVaradkar decision to stop new Oil exploration licences in our Atlantic waters but it should be extended to all drilling for oil & gas. Gas use has expanded Fourfold since 1990 & is forecast to increase 43% by 2030. This is imcompatible with climate science. @SEAI_ie https://t.co/bq0dc0PQVT

Here's Ruby who is 9 years old.  If we are brave, we can make history and give her back a secure future.  #ClimateStrike #Fridays4Future #schoolstrike4climate #dublin #ireland @GretaThunberg https://t.co/J8nP8vSkuy
What do we want - climate action - when do we want it? Now! #ClimateStrike #FridaysForFuture #schoolstrike4climate https://t.co/niZIWNDvKK
Great gathering in Dublin. Marching for our common home. #FridaysForFuture #schoolstrike4climate #ClimateStrike #dublin #Ireland https://t.co/YeScNkzWTA
